command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $sessions = get-rdmsession; $password = read-host -assecurestring "Password"; Export-RDMSession -XML -Path C:\MyPath\MyFilename.xml -Sessions $sessions -Password $password

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and export them to a xml file at C:\MyPath\Filename.xml.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMSession -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMSession -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions, deletes session at index 1.
Force delete of the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: You will be prompted to confirm the delete.
Forces removal of the SQL Login without confirmation by the user. Optional.
Forces removal of the user without confirmation by the user. Optional.
Specifies the GUID of the user to be deleted from.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMUser -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMUser -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available users, deletes user at index 1.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a role to an user.
Remove a role to an user.
Role object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMRole or created via New-RDMRole.
User object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMUser or created via New-RDMUser.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMRoleToUser -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMRoleToUser -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove role to an user.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the local playlists of the current data source
Get the local playlists of the current data source

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Get-RDMPlaylistLocal -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Get-RDMPlaylistLocal -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the local playlists of the current data source.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies the datasource to set current
Specifies the GUID of the data source to set as the current.
The value must be a valid GUID, in the form {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMCurrentDataSource -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMCurrentDataSource -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available data sources and sets the current data source the the second element in the list.
Set active data source to the data source with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Save a document in the current data source
Save a document in the current data source
Specifies the the document to set/save.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionDocument -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionDocument -full".

maml:description.maml:para: Save a shared playlist in the current data source
Save a shared playlist in the current data source
Import the playlist connections to the data source.
Specifies the the shared playlist to set/save.
Save the shared playlist in the private vault.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMPlaylistShared -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMPlaylistShared -full".

maml:description.maml:para: Import the playlist connections to the data source.
Specifies the the local playlist to set/save.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMPlaylistLocal -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMPlaylistLocal -full".

maml:description.maml:para: Save/set the datasource. Datasource must be first fetch via Data source property of the Get-RDMDataSource cmdlet or via the New-RDMDataSource result.
Specifies the the data source to set/save.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMDataSource -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMDataSource -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Change the name of the first data source

maml:description.maml:para: Save/set the datasource. Datasource must be first fetch via Data source property of the Get-RDMDataSource cmdlet or via the New-RDMDataSource result.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMDatasourceProperty -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMDatasourceProperty -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Change the name of the first data source

maml:description.maml:para: Set RDM personal credentials. (Username/Password type only)
Set RDM personal credentials. (Username/Password type only)
Set Always ask password option in personal credentials

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMPersonalCredentials -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMPersonalCredentials -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set RDM personal credentials. (Username/Password type only)

maml:description.maml:para: Save/set the role. Role must be first fetch via role property of the Get-RDMRole cmdlet or via the New-RDMRole result.
Role object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMRoleSecurityGroup or created via New-RDMRole.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMRole -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMRole -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create & save new role.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the value of property given to a role.
Set the value of property given to a role.
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMRoleProperty -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMRoleProperty -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the description value for the role given.
Retrieves the list of available role and then sets the description value of the the second element in the list.

maml:description.maml:para: Save/set the SecurityGroup. SecurityGroup must be first fetch via SecurityGroup property of the Get-RDMSecurityGroup cmdlet or via the New-RDMSecurityGroup result.
Security group object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMSecurityGroup or created via New-RDMSecurityGroup.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSecurityGroup -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSecurityGroup -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create & save new security group.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the value of property given to a security group.
Protected values will always return null.
Non value types will always return ".ToString()".

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSecurityGroupProperty -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSecurityGroupProperty -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available security groups and then sets the description value of the the second element in the list.
Set the description value for the security group given.

maml:description.maml:para: Save the session in the user private vault
Save the session in the user private vault
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.
PSSession object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMSession or Get-RDMPrivateSession or created via New-RDMSession.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMPrivateSession -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMPrivateSession -full".

maml:description.maml:para: Save/set the session. Session must be first fetch via Session property of the Get-RDM-Session cmdlet or via the New-RDMSession result.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.
PSSession object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMSession or created via New-RDMSession.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSession -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSession -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions, modify the name of the second session, update the session.
Create & save new session.

maml:description.maml:para: Set the domain from the specified session.
Set the domain from the specified session.
Specifies the ID of the session to get the domain from.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.
Specifies the session to set the Domain to.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionDomain -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionDomain -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and sets the domain from the the second element in the list with UI refresh.
Set the domain from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Set the password from the specified session.
Set the password from the specified session. Session must be marked as "Allow show credentials" if not null is returned.
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.
Specifies the session to set the password to.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionPassword -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionPassword -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and sets the password from the the second element in the list.
Set the password from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Set the value of property given a session ID and path.
Protected values will always return null.
Non value types will always return ".ToString()".
Specifies the ID of the session to get the password from.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.
The path to the property being read (reference RDM export xml). In the case of top level property do not specify parameter or pass empty string [""] or $null.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionProperty -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionProperty -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 1-----------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $list = Get-RDMSession; Set-RDMSessionProperty -ID $list[1].ID -Path "MetaInformation" -Property "OS" -Value "Windows Server 2008 R2"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available sessions and then sets the MetaInformation.OS value of the the second element in the list.

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE 2-----------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-RDMSessionProperty -ID "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}" -Property "Group" -Value "My New Group Name"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the Group value from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Set the MetaInformation.OS value from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".

maml:description.maml:para: Set the username on the specified session.
Set the username on the specified session.
Specifies the ID of the session to set the password from.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.
Specifies the session to set the username to

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionUsername -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMSessionUsername -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the username from the session with ID = "{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}".
Retrieves the list of available sessions and gets the password from the the second element in the list.

maml:description.maml:para: User object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMUser or created via New-RDMUser.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUser -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUser -full".

maml:description.maml:para: Allows the user to add entries in groups/folders for that security group.
Allows the user to Delete the entries for that security group.
Allows the user to Edit the entries for that security group.
Security group object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMSecurityGroup or created via New-RDMSecurityGroup.
User object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMUser or created via New-RDMUser.
Allows the user to View AND USE the entries for that security group.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserGroupRights -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserGroupRights -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the list of available users and groups. Set permission add and delete to the second user of the list on the first group of the list

maml:description.maml:para: Set the value of property given to a user.
Set the value of property given to a user.
Specifies the GUID of the user to get the password from.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserProperty -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserProperty -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the description value for the user given.
Retrieves the list of available users and then sets the description value of the the second element in the list.

maml:description.maml:para: Allows the user to move the sessions using drag-and-drop from other applications.
Allows the user to use the Reveal Password command.
Allows the user to Export sessions.
Allows the user to Import sessions.
Allows the user to see the content of the Details tab for all sessions.
Allows the user to see the content of the Logs that apply to a session.
Allows the user to see the content of the Information tab for all sessions.
Do not send refresh notification back to Remote Desktop Manager.
This should be used when looping trough psSessions.
Allows the user to enable the Offline Mode on the data sources. Choose between:
Disabled : no offline cache allowed for that user
ReadOnly : a read-only cache is allowed for Advanced Data Sources.
ReadWrite : an advanced cache, with change synchronization, is allowed for Advanced Data Sources.
User object, must be retrieved from Get-RDMUser or created via New-RDMUser.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserSecurity -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Set-RDMUserSecurity -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set user to allow it to import, export, not allow to reveal password and set offline mode to read/write and

maml:description.maml:para: Forces removal of the attachment without confirmation by the user. Optional.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMSessionAttachment -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Remove-RDMSessionAttachment -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $session = Get-RDMSession -Name MySession; $attachments = Get-RDMSessionAttachment -Session $session; Update-RDMSessionAttachment -Attachment $attachments[0]

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove the first attachment in the session.

maml:description.maml:para: Attachment to update the document to.
Send refresh notification to Remote Desktop Manager application.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Update-RDMSessionAttachment -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Update-RDMSessionAttachment -full".

command:example.maml:title: ------------------EXAMPLE------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $session = Get-RDMSession -Name MySession; $attachments = Get-RDMSessionAttachment -Session $session; Update-RDMSessionAttachment -Attachment $attachments[0] -Filename 'C:\Mytestfile.txt'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update the first attachment to the document at 'C:\Mytestfile.txt'.

maml:alert.maml:para: For more information, type "Get-Help Update-RDMUI -detailed". For technical information, type "Get-Help Update-RDMUI -full".

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update RDM user interface.
